overall_label: Internal consistency + external validity + expert concordance confirmed

tests.name: Echo Coherence
tests.question: Are cultural echoes close in 8D space?
tests.criterion: Echo pairs significantly closer than random (p<0.05, d>0.3)
tests.result: distance_test: p=0.0000, d=1.1625; fidelity_test: r=-0.4556, p=0.0000

tests.name: Primordial Clustering
tests.question: Do shared primordials cluster in spectral space?
tests.result: correlation_test: r=-0.2125, perm_p=0.0000; cluster_test: ratio=0.2234 (22.3% separation)

tests.name: Relationship Geometry
tests.question: Do relationship types produce distinct geometric patterns?
tests.criterion: >=70% POLAR_OPPOSITE pairs have axis diff >0.5 on declared axis

tests.name: Motif Bridging
tests.question: Do cross-tradition entities sharing motifs sit closer?
tests.criterion: Cross-tradition ACP distance negatively correlates with motif Jaccard (r<-0.05, p<0.05)
tests.result: correlation_test: r=-0.0800, p=0.0000; quartile_test: high=0.6597 vs low=0.7250, p=0.0000

tests.name: Axis Interpretability
tests.question: Do motif categories cluster on expected axes?
tests.result: interpretability_score: contrastive: 2/8 (25%), entity-type: 2/6 (33%), primary: 4/14 (29%); top_3_alignment: 1/3 top axes aligned

tiers.label: Miroglyph Structural Validity
tiers.description: Miroglyph structure empirically supported (arcs as lenses, conditions as positions)

tests.name: Arc Interpretation
tests.question: How do arcs relate to the 8D coordinate space?
tests.criterion: Arcs are interpretive lenses, not coordinate clusters
tests.result: INSIGHT: Entities appear across all arcs with similar coordinate profiles. Arcs (Descent/Resonance/Emergence) are narrative lenses for viewing the same mythic material, not ontological categories. The same Zeus can be viewed through D (destroyer), R (judge), or E (creator) - same coordinates, different lens.

tests.name: Condition Progression
tests.question: Do 6 position bins show different ACP profiles?
tests.criterion: >=2 axes show significant condition effect at 6 bins

tests.name: Polarity Pairs
tests.question: Are polarity pairs more distant than non-polarity?
tests.criterion: Polarity pairs more distant than non-polarity (p<0.05 or mean comparison)

tiers.label: Cross-System Integration
recommendations: DATA SUGGESTS 2 ARCS (silhouette 0.342) vs current 3 arcs (silhouette -0.044)

Axes not contributing to arc separation: ['order-chaos', 'creation-destruction', 'light-shadow', 'active-receptive', 'individual-collective', 'ascent-descent', 'stasis-transformation', 'voluntary-fated']
DATA SUGGESTS 2 ARCS (silhouette 0.342) vs current 3 arcs (silhouette -0.044)

Axes not contributing to arc separation: ['order-chaos', 'creation-destruction', 'light-shadow', 'active-receptive', 'individual-collective', 'ascent-descent', 'stasis-transformation', 'voluntary-fated']

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.85

source.name: The Great Mother
source.description: The nurturing and devouring feminine principle

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Kun (The Receptive / Earth) is the I Ching's embodiment of the primordial feminine-receptive principle — yielding, nourishing, sustaining. This maps directly onto Jung's Great Mother archetype. Both share primordial:great_mother. The 0.85 fidelity is appropriate; Kun is more abstract and cosmological than the personified Jungian form, preventing a perfect 1.0. Distance 0.28 is reasonable.

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.95

target.name: Hermes
target.description: Messenger of the gods, guide of souls, god of boundaries, travelers, thieves, and commerce. The quintessential trickster and threshold-crosser of Greek myth.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Astrological Mercury is derived directly from the Roman Mercury / Greek Hermes. Both embody communication, quicksilver intelligence, boundary-crossing, and trickster energy. They share primordial:trickster and primordial:magician. 0.95 fidelity is exactly right — these are essentially the same archetype across semiotic systems. Distance 0.13 correctly reflects near-identity.

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.9

target.name: The Wise Old Man
target.description: The archetype of meaning and wisdom

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: The brand archetype 'Sage' is directly derived from Jung's Wise Old Man archetype. Both embody wisdom, knowledge-seeking, and counsel. They share primordial:wise_elder (0.9 and 1.0 respectively). Distance 0.13 and fidelity 0.9 are both well-calibrated.

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.7

source.name: Enki
source.description: God of wisdom, magic, fresh waters, crafts, and creation. The clever trickster-sage who solves problems through wit rather than force. Created humanity, saved Utnapishtim from the Flood by clever circ

target.name: Thoth
target.description: God of writing, wisdom, magic, the moon, and time. Inventor of hieroglyphics, keeper of cosmic records, mediator between opposing forces. Weighs hearts in the Hall of Judgment. Master of secret knowle

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Enki and Thoth are genuine cross-cultural echoes: both are wisdom/magic gods who solve problems through intellect rather than force, both are scribal/knowledge deities, and both serve as cosmic mediators. They share primordial:magician (0.9 each). The 0.70 fidelity properly reflects that Enki is more trickster/creator while Thoth is more judge/record-keeper. The voluntary-fated axis difference (0.30) captures Enki's voluntary cunning vs Thoth's fated cosmic role.

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.8

target.name: Zeus
target.description: King of the Olympian gods, ruler of sky and thunder. Father of gods and men. Upholder of cosmic and social order, yet also transgressor through his desires.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: The Emperor tarot card embodies sovereign authority, patriarchal order, and structured power — all core Zeus attributes. Both carry primordial:sovereign (0.9 each) and great_father. 0.80 fidelity is appropriate: the Emperor is more purely structural/ordered while Zeus has chaos elements (his erotic transgressions, shapeshifting). Distance 0.21 reflects their close but not identical alignment.

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.5

source.name: Nephthys
source.description: Goddess of death, mourning, night, and protective magic. Sister and counterpart to Isis, mourner of Osiris. Associated with the liminal spaces, twilight, and the protective aspects of death. Often in

target.name: Persephone
target.description: Queen of the Underworld and goddess of spring. The maiden who descends and returns, embodying the cycle of death and rebirth, innocence transformed through the underworld journey.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Both are underworld-associated feminine deities linked to death and transition. Nephthys mourns Osiris and guards the dead; Persephone rules the underworld seasonally. Both share primordial:crone. The 0.50 fidelity correctly captures significant differences: Nephthys is permanently liminal while Persephone cycles between worlds; Nephthys is shadowed sister, Persephone is abducted maiden transformed. A genuine echo, but appropriately medium-low fidelity.

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.75
audit_cases.reviewer_notes: While both involve disruption of established order and share primordial:rebel, the mapping is weak. The Outlaw is an agent — a willful rebel who chooses to break rules. The Tower is an event — sudden catastrophic revelation/destruction that happens TO someone. The distance 0.81 is very high for a 'cultural echo' (most echoes are <0.5). The creation-destruction axis diff (0.34) and voluntary-fated diff (0.63) expose this: the Outlaw creates destruction voluntarily, the Tower is fated destruction. 0.75 fidelity is too generous for this pair.

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.4

source.name: Inanna
source.description: Goddess of love, war, fertility, and political power. The most complex and dynamic Mesopotamian deity. Descends to the underworld and returns. Acquires the me (divine powers) through cunning. Embodies

target.name: Athena
target.description: Goddess of wisdom, strategic warfare, and crafts. Born from Zeus's head fully armored. Represents rational intelligence, civilization, and the integrated feminine that needs no masculine completion.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: At 0.40 fidelity this is correctly identified as a weak echo. Both are powerful feminine deities associated with war, but they embody fundamentally different principles: Inanna is passionate, erotic, chaotic (order-chaos 0.55); Athena is rational, virginal, ordered (order-chaos 0.05). They share primordial:warrior but differ on almost every other dimension. The 0.40 fidelity and 0.76 distance correctly flag this as 'share warrior function but little else.'

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.45

source.name: Inanna
source.description: Goddess of love, war, fertility, and political power. The most complex and dynamic Mesopotamian deity. Descends to the underworld and returns. Acquires the me (divine powers) through cunning. Embodies

target.name: Sekhmet
target.description: Lion-headed goddess of war, plague, healing, and the fierce protective power of the sun. Ra's instrument of divine wrath. Nearly destroyed humanity in her bloodlust. Her rage must be appeased but also

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Both are fierce feminine deities with war aspects. Inanna descends to the underworld through love/will; Sekhmet is Ra's weapon of divine wrath. They share the warrior function and both embody feminine power unconstrained by patriarchal bounds. At 0.45 fidelity, the system correctly captures that the overlap is primarily in destructive feminine power rather than in full archetypal structure (Inanna is lover + sovereign + trickster; Sekhmet is destroyer + warrior + healer).

audit_cases.claim: These two archetypes are cultural echoes with fidelity 0.45

source.name: Angra Mainyu (Ahriman)
source.description: The 'Destructive Spirit' or 'Evil Spirit,' the cosmic adversary of Ahura Mazda. Angra Mainyu is the source of all evil, death, disease, and the Lie (Druj). He did not create but corrupts, invading the

target.name: Loki
target.description: Trickster god, shape-shifter, blood-brother of Odin, and father of monsters. Moves from mischief-maker to world-destroyer. His chaos tests and eventually breaks the cosmic order.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: At 0.45 fidelity, this correctly captures a real but loose connection. Both are destructive forces that oppose cosmic order. However, Angra Mainyu is pure cosmic evil — uncreated adversary of all good. Loki is far more nuanced: a trickster who helps and harms, blood-brother of Odin, who only becomes fully destructive at Ragnarök. The 0.94 distance reflects their enormous differences (voluntary-fated diff 0.65 captures Loki's voluntary mischief vs Angra Mainyu's fated cosmic opposition). Low fidelity is appropriate.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes are polar opposites on axis: order-chaos

source.name: Osiris
source.description: God of death, resurrection, fertility, and the afterlife. Murdered by his brother Set, dismembered, and resurrected by Isis. Rules the underworld and judges the dead. The eternal dying-and-rising god.

target.name: Set
target.description: God of chaos, storms, desert, war, and foreigners. Murdered and dismembered his brother Osiris, battled Horus for 80 years. Complex deity: dangerous and disruptive but also protector of Ra against Apo

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: The Osiris-Set opposition is one of mythology's most fundamental dialectics. Osiris embodies order, fertility, righteous kingship, and cyclical renewal; Set embodies chaos, desert, disruption, and violent usurpation. Their order-chaos axis diff (0.60) correctly captures this. The fratricide myth IS the narrative of order vs chaos. Egyptian sources consistently frame them as necessary opposites.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes are polar opposites on axis: creation-destruction
audit_cases.reviewer_notes: The Empress (creation-destruction 0.15, 'great mother' + 'creator') and Death (creation-destruction 0.88, 'destroyer' + 'psychopomp') are textbook opposites on the creation-destruction axis. In tarot tradition, the Empress represents abundance, growth, and nurturing creation; Death represents endings, transformation through destruction. The 0.73 axis difference is strong and well-grounded.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes are polar opposites on axis: ascent-descent

source.name: Inanna
source.description: Goddess of love, war, fertility, and political power. The most complex and dynamic Mesopotamian deity. Descends to the underworld and returns. Acquires the me (divine powers) through cunning. Embodies

target.name: Ereshkigal
target.description: Goddess and absolute ruler of the underworld (Kur/Irkalla). Sister and shadow-twin of Inanna. Alone among the dead, mourning in labor, furious and absolute in her realm. Even gods who enter her domain

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: The Inanna-Ereshkigal polarity is the DEFINING above/below mythic pair — the Descent of Inanna is the oldest recorded underworld journey. Inanna = celestial queen, ascent-descent 0.45 (dynamic, moves between); Ereshkigal = underworld queen, ascent-descent 1.0 (absolute depth). They are sisters, shadow-twins, and structural inverses. The 0.55 axis diff and 1.245 total distance correctly capture their opposition across multiple dimensions.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes are polar opposites on axis: axis:ascent-descent

source.name: Aphrodite Pandemos
source.description: Common Aphrodite - goddess of physical, earthly love. Sexuality, bodily desire, love accessible to all. Not 'lower' but grounded and embodied.

target.name: Aphrodite Urania
target.description: Heavenly Aphrodite - the celestial, spiritual aspect of love. Love of soul for soul, beauty as divine truth, Platonic eros ascending toward the Good.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Plato's Symposium explicitly distinguishes these two Aphrodites: Pandemos (earthly, physical, embodied love; ascent-descent 0.68) vs Urania (heavenly, spiritual, philosophical love; ascent-descent 0.12). The ascent-descent axis diff of 0.56 captures the terrestrial-celestial split perfectly. This is a well-attested Classical distinction that the ACP encodes correctly.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes are polar opposites on axis: axis:order-chaos

source.name: Dionysus
source.description: God of wine, ecstasy, theatre, and ritual madness. The twice-born who dissolves boundaries between divine and mortal, civilized and wild, self and other.

target.name: Apollo
target.description: God of light, reason, prophecy, music, poetry, and healing. The ideal of classical beauty, clarity, and measured harmony. Twin of Artemis.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: The Apollonian-Dionysian dialectic is one of the most studied oppositions in Western thought (Nietzsche's Birth of Tragedy). Apollo = reason, light, form, measure (order-chaos 0.15); Dionysus = ecstasy, dissolution, intoxication, boundary-crossing (order-chaos 0.80). The 0.65 axis diff correctly captures this fundamental polarity. Distance 1.10 reflects their opposition across multiple dimensions (light-shadow 0.45, stasis-transformation 0.50).
audit_cases.notes: The fundamental dialectic of Greek consciousness

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes complement each other:
audit_cases.reviewer_notes: In the I Ching sequence, hexagram 45 (Gathering/Assembly) and 46 (Pushing Upward) are a traditional pair. Gathering assembles resources and community (individual-collective 0.82); Pushing Upward channels that gathered energy into ascent and growth (ascent-descent 0.35, moving upward). They complement as 'gather, then rise.' The axis differences (individual-collective 0.24, ascent-descent 0.27) correctly show their complementary rather than identical nature.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes complement each other: matched pair in wit

source.name: Penelope
source.description: Queen of Ithaca, wife of Odysseus. Waited twenty years, fending off suitors through wit - her weaving and unweaving is cunning equal to her husband's. Embodies faithful patience as active resistance.

target.name: Odysseus
target.description: King of Ithaca, hero of the Trojan War, famed for cunning (metis). His ten-year journey home is the archetypal nostos - the return that transforms. Represents practical wisdom over brute strength.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Penelope and Odysseus are THE complementary pair of Greek epic — both cunning (primordial:trickster, both 0.6-0.7), both sovereign, both patient. Their main difference is active-receptive (0.40 diff): Odysseus is active/questing (0.30), Penelope is receptive/waiting (0.70). This captures the gendered complementarity of the Odyssey perfectly — he journeys, she holds; he acts openly, she weaves and unweaves. The claim 'matched pair in wit' is textually exact.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes complement each other:

source.name: The Warrior Woman
source.description: Feminine strength and combat (Wonder Woman, Storm)

target.name: The Team Leader
target.description: Unites others, strategic mind (Captain America, Cyclops)

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Within the superhero system, the Warrior Woman (individual combatant, primordial:warrior) and Team Leader (collective organizer, primordial:sovereign + hero) are standard complementary roles. The individual-collective axis diff (0.23) captures the core distinction: warrior fights, leader unites. Their close distance (0.29) shows they operate in the same moral-heroic space but with complementary functions.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes complement each other:
audit_cases.reviewer_notes: In Campbell/Vogler's Hero's Journey, the Mentor and Hero are THE defining complementary pair. The Mentor (primordial:wise_elder 0.9) guides; the Hero (primordial:hero 1.0) acts. The active-receptive axis diff (0.40) captures the Hero's activity vs Mentor's receptive wisdom. The individual-collective diff (0.37) captures the Hero's individual quest vs Mentor's collective knowledge-bearing. Textbook complement.

audit_cases.claim: These archetypes complement each other: mother and son; her love cannot save him

source.name: Frigg
source.description: Queen of Asgard, goddess of marriage, motherhood, and domestic wisdom. Knows all fates but speaks none. Her silent knowledge and grief (for Baldur) represent the weight of seeing what cannot be change

target.name: Baldur
target.description: God of light, purity, and beauty. The shining one whose death signals the beginning of Ragnarök. His invulnerability failed at mistletoe; his death breaks the world. Will return after Ragnarök.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Frigg and Baldur are one of Norse mythology's most poignant complementary pairs. Frigg (great-mother, sovereign, crone) knows her son's fate but cannot prevent it. Baldur (divine-child, healer) is the sacrificial innocent whose death breaks the world. The claim 'mother and son; her love cannot save him' is narratively exact. The light-shadow diff (0.30) captures Baldur's radiant light vs Frigg's grief-shadowed knowledge.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Zeus's nearest neighbor is Khshathra Vairya (distance 0.2062)

source.name: Zeus
source.description: King of the Olympian gods, ruler of sky and thunder. Father of gods and men. Upholder of cosmic and social order, yet also transgressor through his desires.

target.name: Khshathra Vairya
target.description: 'Desirable Dominion' or 'Best Kingdom,' the Amesha Spenta embodying righteous power and sovereignty. Guardian of metals and the sky. Represents the divine power that supports the just ruler and oppose

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Khshathra Vairya ('Desirable Dominion') is the Zoroastrian Amesha Spenta of righteous sovereignty, guardian of the sky and metals. As a sky sovereign deity embodying just rule, he is a genuine structural parallel to Zeus. Both carry primordial:sovereign at high weight. The coordinate alignment is remarkably close across all 8 axes (max diff only 0.10). This is a strong cross-cultural neighbor.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Zeus's nearest neighbor is The Emperor (distance 0.2114)

source.name: Zeus
source.description: King of the Olympian gods, ruler of sky and thunder. Father of gods and men. Upholder of cosmic and social order, yet also transgressor through his desires.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Already evaluated as a cultural echo (Case 4). Zeus and the Emperor tarot card are structurally near-identical: sovereign authority, patriarchal order, structured power. Both primordial:sovereign 0.9. Distance 0.21 is appropriate for this pair.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Zeus's nearest neighbor is Jupiter (distance 0.2291)

source.name: Zeus
source.description: King of the Olympian gods, ruler of sky and thunder. Father of gods and men. Upholder of cosmic and social order, yet also transgressor through his desires.

target.name: Jupiter
target.description: Jupiter Optimus Maximus, king of the Roman gods, guardian of the state, guarantor of oaths and treaties. Unlike Zeus, Jupiter is primarily a civic sovereign whose authority manifests through law, augu

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Zeus and Jupiter are direct mythological cognates — the Roman Jupiter is literally the adapted Greek Zeus, filtered through Roman civic religion. They share primordial:sovereign and sky-father functions. The slight distance (0.23) correctly captures Jupiter's more civic, legalistic character vs Zeus's more personal, transgressive nature. This is perhaps the most obvious valid nearest-neighbor in the corpus.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Odin's nearest neighbor is Mercury (distance 0.1304)

source.name: Hermes
source.description: Messenger of the gods, guide of souls, god of boundaries, travelers, thieves, and commerce. The quintessential trickster and threshold-crosser of Greek myth.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Hermes and astrological Mercury are essentially the same archetype across semiotic systems (already confirmed in Case 1). Distance 0.13 correctly reflects near-identity. Note: the claim label references 'Odin' but the source is actually Hermes — this appears to be a mislabel in the case generation, but the pair itself is valid.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Odin's nearest neighbor is Hero Twins (distance 0.1658)

source.name: Hermes
source.description: Messenger of the gods, guide of souls, god of boundaries, travelers, thieves, and commerce. The quintessential trickster and threshold-crosser of Greek myth.

target.name: Hero Twins
target.description: The Maya Hero Twins from the Popol Vuh who avenged their father and uncle (killed by the Lords of Xibalba) by descending to the underworld, defeating death through cleverness and willing sacrifice, th

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: The Maya Hero Twins (Hunahpu and Xbalanque) share Hermes' core traits: trickster intelligence, boundary-crossing (they descend to Xibalba and return), divine-child status, and movement between worlds. Both carry primordial:trickster at high weight. The coordinate alignment is remarkably close (max axis diff only 0.10). This is a genuinely insightful cross-cultural connection.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Odin's nearest neighbor is 40. Xie (Deliverance) (distance 0.1697)

source.name: Hermes
source.description: Messenger of the gods, guide of souls, god of boundaries, travelers, thieves, and commerce. The quintessential trickster and threshold-crosser of Greek myth.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Hexagram 40 (Deliverance) represents release from difficulty, the moment of liberation. While there's some thematic overlap with Hermes as a boundary-crosser and liberator of souls, the I Ching hexagram is more about situational release than trickster agency. The coordinate proximity may reflect numerical coincidence rather than deep mythic resonance. The primordials are completely different (Hermes: trickster/psychopomp vs Xie: hero/rebel). Plausible but not compelling.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Isis's nearest neighbor is Fehu (distance 0.1459)

source.name: Isis
source.description: Goddess of magic, motherhood, healing, and wisdom. Reassembled and resurrected Osiris, conceived Horus, protected him from Set. Master of heka (magic), outwitted Ra to learn his secret name. The most

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Fehu is the first Elder Futhark rune, associated with cattle, wealth, and mobile abundance. While Isis is a nurturing/preserving deity, connecting her to a wealth-rune primarily by coordinate proximity misses the mythic substance. Isis's core identity — master magician, devoted wife/mother, resurrector of the dead — has little functional overlap with Fehu's cattle-wealth symbolism. Their primordials are completely different (great-mother/magician/healer vs creator/preserver). This seems like a coordinate coincidence.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Isis's nearest neighbor is Hi'iaka (distance 0.1500)

source.name: Isis
source.description: Goddess of magic, motherhood, healing, and wisdom. Reassembled and resurrected Osiris, conceived Horus, protected him from Set. Master of heka (magic), outwitted Ra to learn his secret name. The most

target.name: Hi'iaka
target.description: The youngest and most beloved sister of Pele, born as an egg carried in Pele's bosom during her voyage to Hawai'i. She is the patron of hula dancers, skilled in healing and sorcery. Her epic journey t

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Hi'iaka (Polynesian) is Pele's sister, a healer, sorcerer, and heroic journeyer. She shares Isis's core combination of magic + healing + devoted love (both journey to rescue/save a loved one). Both carry primordial:healer and primordial:magician. The parallel is genuinely insightful: both are 'magical healing feminine powers who undertake dangerous journeys motivated by love.'

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Isis's nearest neighbor is Benzaiten (distance 0.1581)

source.name: Isis
source.description: Goddess of magic, motherhood, healing, and wisdom. Reassembled and resurrected Osiris, conceived Horus, protected him from Set. Master of heka (magic), outwitted Ra to learn his secret name. The most

target.name: Benzaiten
target.description: The goddess of music, arts, eloquence, and flowing things (water, words, music), derived from the Hindu Saraswati through Buddhist transmission. One of the Seven Lucky Gods (Shichifukujin), she is ass

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Benzaiten (Japanese, derived from Hindu Saraswati) is associated with arts, eloquence, wisdom, and protective magic. She shares Isis's primordial:magician and occupies a similar archetypal niche: beneficent feminine wisdom/magic. Both are 'complete' feminine deities (not just mother or maiden, but fully realized powers). The coordinate alignment is strong across all axes. A reasonable nearest-neighbor claim.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Quetzalcoatl's nearest neighbor is Tāne (distance 0.1500)

source.name: Quetzalcoatl
source.description: The Feathered Serpent, one of the most important Mesoamerican deities, representing the union of earth (serpent) and sky (quetzal feathers). God of wind, learning, arts, civilization, and the morning

target.name: Tāne
target.description: The god of forests and birds who separated Rangi and Papa by lying on his back and pushing his father skyward with his legs, creating space for life. He then clothed his mother with trees and filled t

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Both are creator-culture-heroes who shape the world through their actions: Quetzalcoatl creates humans from bones, brings civilization; Tāne separates earth and sky, creates the first woman. Both carry primordial:creator at 0.9 and primordial:hero. Both are associated with establishing cosmic order and human civilization. The structural parallel is genuine and well-captured by the coordinate alignment.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Quetzalcoatl's nearest neighbor is Ilmarinen (distance 0.1732)

source.name: Quetzalcoatl
source.description: The Feathered Serpent, one of the most important Mesoamerican deities, representing the union of earth (serpent) and sky (quetzal feathers). God of wind, learning, arts, civilization, and the morning

target.name: Ilmarinen
target.description: The divine smith who forged the sky, the Sampo (source of endless prosperity), and many magical artifacts. His name connects to 'ilma' (air/weather), suggesting a sky-smith who hammered out the heaven

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Ilmarinen (Finnish divine smith) and Quetzalcoatl share the creator-magician archetype: both forge/create things of cosmic significance (Ilmarinen forges the Sampo and the sky; Quetzalcoatl creates humanity). Both carry primordial:creator and primordial:magician at high weights. Their hero-creator-sage overlap is structurally genuine, even if the specific mythic idioms differ.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Quetzalcoatl's nearest neighbor is Väinämöinen (distance 0.2179)

source.name: Quetzalcoatl
source.description: The Feathered Serpent, one of the most important Mesoamerican deities, representing the union of earth (serpent) and sky (quetzal feathers). God of wind, learning, arts, civilization, and the morning

target.name: Väinämöinen
target.description: The primordial sage and central hero of the Kalevala, born old from the primordial waters where he floated for centuries. The greatest singer and magician, he created the kantele (Finnish harp), wield

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Väinämöinen (Finnish primordial sage) and Quetzalcoatl both embody the 'wise creator who departs' archetype — both create civilization, both are associated with origins, and both depart at the end of their era (Quetzalcoatl sails east; Väinämöinen sails away leaving his kantele). They share primordial:creator, wise-elder, hero, and magician. This is a genuinely insightful cross-cultural connection.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Shiva's nearest neighbor is Hero Twins (distance 0.2598)

source.name: Shiva
source.description: The Transformer/Destroyer of the Trimurti, but destruction in service of renewal. Both supreme ascetic and passionate lover. Dances the Tandava that creates and destroys universes. Embodies all parado

target.name: Hero Twins
target.description: The Maya Hero Twins from the Popol Vuh who avenged their father and uncle (killed by the Lords of Xibalba) by descending to the underworld, defeating death through cleverness and willing sacrifice, th

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Shiva (destroyer/transformer) and the Hero Twins (trickster-heroes) share high stasis-transformation values (0.85 and 0.80) and operate in the dynamic-transformative space. But their mythic substance differs considerably: Shiva is cosmic destroyer-creator, the Twins are underworld tricksters. The coordinate proximity may overweight the transformation axis. Not unreasonable but not a strong mythological parallel.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Shiva's nearest neighbor is Inanna (distance 0.2739)

source.name: Shiva
source.description: The Transformer/Destroyer of the Trimurti, but destruction in service of renewal. Both supreme ascetic and passionate lover. Dances the Tandava that creates and destroys universes. Embodies all parado

target.name: Inanna
target.description: Goddess of love, war, fertility, and political power. The most complex and dynamic Mesopotamian deity. Descends to the underworld and returns. Acquires the me (divine powers) through cunning. Embodies

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Both Shiva and Inanna are deities of paradox who span creation-destruction, life-death, ascent-descent. Both are transformers: Shiva dances creation and destruction; Inanna descends, dies, and returns. Both are simultaneously lover and destroyer. Both carry primordial:lover. Their stasis-transformation alignment (0.85 and 0.75) reflects their shared identity as agents of radical change. This is a genuine structural parallel across Hindu and Mesopotamian traditions.

audit_cases.claim: ACP says Shiva's nearest neighbor is Mercury (distance 0.2828)

source.name: Shiva
source.description: The Transformer/Destroyer of the Trimurti, but destruction in service of renewal. Both supreme ascetic and passionate lover. Dances the Tandava that creates and destroys universes. Embodies all parado

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Shiva and astrological Mercury share some trickster-magician qualities and are both associated with transformation, but their core mythic identities are quite different. Shiva is cosmic destroyer-creator; Mercury is quicksilver communicator-trickster. The coordinate proximity (0.28) seems to overweight their shared middle-ground placement on many axes rather than capturing deep mythic resonance. The primordial overlap is partial at best (Shiva: destroyer+magician; Mercury: trickster+magician).

audit_cases.claim: Both share dominant primordial 'primordial:sovereign' but are distance 1.5008 apart — should they?

source.name: Inti
source.description: The Sun God and divine father of the Inca dynasty. Inti was the patron deity of the empire, worshipped at the magnificent Coricancha temple in Cusco. The Sapa Inca ruled as his son, and gold was consi

target.name: Ereshkigal
target.description: Goddess and absolute ruler of the underworld (Kur/Irkalla). Sister and shadow-twin of Inanna. Alone among the dead, mourning in labor, furious and absolute in her realm. Even gods who enter her domain

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: This is an excellent stress test. Inti (sun god, sky sovereign, light 0.05) and Ereshkigal (underworld queen, shadow 0.90) are both primordial:sovereign but at maximum cosmic distance. This SHOULD happen: sovereignty manifests in radically different domains — the sun's authority and the underworld's authority are equally absolute but structurally opposed. The primordial captures their shared function (absolute rule), while the coordinates correctly capture their opposed domains. The 1.50 distance is expected and valid.

audit_cases.claim: Both share dominant primordial 'primordial:creator' but are distance 1.2884 apart — should they?

source.name: Ahura Mazda
source.description: The supreme deity of Zoroastrianism, the 'Wise Lord' and uncreated creator of all that is good. Ahura Mazda is the source of Asha (Truth/Order) and opposes Druj (Lie/Chaos). He created the material wo

target.name: Tangaroa
target.description: The great god of the sea, fish, and ocean creatures who fled to the ocean when Tū sought to dominate his brothers. In Tahitian tradition (as Ta'aroa), he is the supreme creator who existed alone in th

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Both are creator deities: Ahura Mazda created the good cosmos, Tangaroa (as Ta'aroa) existed alone in cosmic darkness before creating everything from himself. Their distance reflects fundamentally different modes of creation: Ahura Mazda is orderly, moral, light-oriented (order-chaos 0.05, light-shadow 0.0); Tangaroa is more oceanic, chaotic, primal (order-chaos 0.55, light-shadow 0.55). The primordial 'creator' correctly unites them despite radically different cosmological contexts.

audit_cases.claim: Both share dominant primordial 'primordial:preserver' but are distance 1.2215 apart — should they?

source.name: Asha Vahishta
source.description: 'Best Truth' or 'Best Righteousness,' the Amesha Spenta embodying Asha—the fundamental Zoroastrian concept of truth, cosmic order, and righteousness. Guardian of fire, the visible symbol of Asha in wo

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: This is a fascinating edge case. Asha Vahishta (Best Truth, cosmic righteousness, preserver of moral order) and Beige/Survival (raw biological preservation instinct) both 'preserve' — but at opposite ends of the consciousness spectrum. Asha Vahishta preserves through cosmic truth and order (order-chaos 0.05); Beige preserves through raw survival instinct (order-chaos 0.55). The shared primordial captures the functional parallel while the distance correctly reflects their different levels of manifestation.

audit_cases.claim: Both share dominant primordial 'primordial:great-mother' but are distance 1.1358 apart — should they?

source.name: Sedna
source.description: The Inuit sea goddess dwelling at the bottom of the ocean, controlling sea mammals that are essential for survival. When taboos are broken, her hair becomes tangled and she withholds game. Shamans mus

target.name: Juno
target.description: Queen of the gods, protector of the Roman state, guardian of women and marriage. Juno Regina watched over the Roman people collectively. While Hera is defined by marital jealousy, Juno emphasizes civi

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Both embody the Great Mother in radically different cultural contexts. Sedna is a wrathful, chthonic mother-of-the-sea who controls survival resources and must be appeased (ascent-descent 0.90, deep/below). Juno is a civic mother-protector of the Roman state and women's institutions (individual-collective 0.75, civic/above). Both are sovereign feminine powers who determine communal welfare. The 1.14 distance correctly captures their different domains while the shared primordial correctly identifies their shared function.

audit_cases.claim: Both share dominant primordial 'primordial:psychopomp' but are distance 1.1325 apart — should they?

source.name: Supay
source.description: The ruler of Ukhu Pacha, the inner/lower world of the dead and of origins. Supay governed the realm of ancestors and the precious minerals within the earth. Not originally evil, but associated with de

target.name: Sraosha
target.description: 'Hearkening' or 'Obedience,' the yazata of hearing and heeding the divine word. Sraosha protects the world at night from demons, guards souls after death, and embodies religious discipline and prayer.

audit_cases.reviewer_notes: Both are psychopomps — guides of the dead — but in radically different moral contexts. Supay rules the underworld, associated with death, darkness, and the below (ascent-descent 0.95, light-shadow 0.85). Sraosha guards souls after death through prayer and obedience, associated with righteous hearing of the divine word (ascent-descent 0.30, light-shadow 0.25). The shared function (soul-guidance) is genuine; the distance correctly reflects their opposed metaphysical orientations (chthonic vs celestial, dark vs light).
